channel.title: Focus on the Family Equipping Parents Podcast
channel.description: Christian mom or dad, could you use some encouragement and support? Put your ear buds in for this Christian parenting podcast and get practical, faith-based inspiration through all stages of parenting — raising toddlers, navigating the school-age years, preparing for puberty, and seeing your teen soar with confidence. Hosted by Danny Huerta, in every 8 to 15 minute episode, you’ll hear parenting experts share Biblical truths, effective parenting techniques, and useful resources that will help you feel equipped as a mom or dad in today’s culture.

item.title: Serving Others & Doing Chores
item.itunes:title: Serving Others & Doing Chores
item.description:
How can we teach our kids to be more generous? Jill Garner talks with Jim Daly about a shopping trip that turned into a powerful lesson. Also, Danny talks about how you can teach your children to live more selfless

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Joy Over Happiness
item.itunes:title: Joy Over Happiness
item.description:
We want our kids to be happy, but joy is something they need. Danny and John discuss the difference between happiness and joy. Plus, Jill Garner joins Jim Daly to share how getting your kids outside of themselves can help them find lasting contentment.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: When a Parent Abandons an Adult Child
item.itunes:title: When a Parent Abandons an Adult Child
item.description:
In some cases, adult kids are the ones who've been wronged by their parents. When that happens, how do you trust God to restore the relationship? Jim Daly and Dr. Gary Chapman give the adult child some practical guidelines for reaching out to an estranged parent. Then, Danny and John will encourage you that it's not too late for a parent-child relationship to be mended.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the book Your New Life with Adult Children an Adult Child for your donation of any amount!

 

Take the 7 Traits of Effective Parenting Assessment

 

How to Positively Influence Your Adult Child 

 

Contact our Counseling Team

 

Redrawing Boundaries With Adult Children

 

Support This Show!

 

If you enjoyed listening to the Focus on Parenting Podcast, please give us your feedback.

item.title: If Your Child is Living an LGBT Lifestyle
item.itunes:title: If Your Child is Living an LGBT Lifestyle
item.description:
Some Christian parents sadly are dealing with the reality that their child identifies with an LGBT lifestyle. Jim Daly and Dr. Gary Chapman address how a parent can respond in a Christ-like manner in that situation. Then, Danny will provide some encouragement, even if your son or daughter is currently in a same-sex relationship.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the book Your New Life with Adult Children an Adult Child for your donation of any amount!

item.title: You the Parent, Will be There
item.itunes:title: You the Parent, Will be There
item.description:
You, the parent, are the most important spiritual influence in your child's life. Danny opens up about how he and Heather brought different strengths to their children's spiritual development. Also, Jim Daly talks to Tim Shoemaker on how a mom and dad can share responsibilities as you teach them about God.

item.title: Entertainment & Teen Dating
item.itunes:title: Entertainment & Teen Dating
item.description:
The teenage years are a wonderful opportunity to grow in discernment. Dr. Ken Wilgus and Jessica Pfeiffer talk with Jim Daly about how your teens can develop discernment with entertainment and dating. Also, Danny and John will remind you to not parent from a place of fear, and why facing challenges is good for a teenager.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: When Self-Esteem is a Bad Message
item.itunes:title: When Self-Esteem is a Bad Message
item.description:
Self-esteem is important. But fixating too much on how your kids feel about themselves is not good for their development. Danny and John share why we need to focus on teaching resilience more than self-esteem. Also, Jim Daly and Jill Garner discuss why healthy self-esteem comes when kids realize life is not all about them.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the book StrongHeart for your donation of any amount!

 

Take the 7 Traits of Effective Parenting Assessment

 

How to Build Moral Courage in Your Kids 

 

Fun Ways to Instill Virtues in Your Children

item.title: What’s Inside Matters Most
item.itunes:title: What’s Inside Matters Most
item.description:
How do you encourage your kids to do what's right, even when the world doesn't? Jim Daly and Jill Garner discuss how an elementary school commencement address inspired her to teach kids about true character. Also, Danny shares about how he's tried teaching his kids to do the right thing, even when it's inconvenient.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: When Your Adult Child Makes a Poor Choice
item.itunes:title: When Your Adult Child Makes a Poor Choice
item.description:
It's one of the hardest things to swallow - when your adult son or daughter makes a decision you strongly disagree with. Dr. Gary Chapman joins Jim Daly to encourage you to not blame yourself if your adult child has made a bad choice. Also, John and Danny will give you some encouragement if your adult son or daughter is struggling.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the book Your New Life with Adult Children an Adult Child for your donation of any amount!

item.itunes:title: Passing Down Your Faith
item.description:
Giving your child a legacy of faith needs to be your top priority. Danny and John address why it's critical to help your kids know who God is. You'll also hear Jim Daly interview Tim Shoemaker on how Psalm 78 inspired him to focus on spiritually training his kids.

item.itunes:title: Talking to Your Teens About Money
item.description:
Conversations about money are some of the most critical discussions you'll have with your teens. Danny opens up about when he started talking to his kids about finances. Also, Jim Daly speaks to Dr. Ken Wilgus and Jessica Pfeiffer about how you as a parent can encourage your teens to manage their finances.

item.title: “Where Do I Send My Kids to School?”
item.itunes:title: “Where Do I Send My Kids to School?”
item.description:
Is there a truly best option for where to send your kids to school? What if one environment works well for one child, but doesn't pan out for another child? Danny and John open up about how they made the best education choices for their own kids. Jim Daly then chats with Dr. Ken Wilgus on how parents can help a kid who's struggling in school.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Transitioning to a Young Adult
item.itunes:title: Transitioning to a Young Adult
item.description:
It's a massive adjustment when your child becomes a teenager. Danny opens up about how he and his wife had to approach things differently when their kids reached the teen years. Also, Jim Daly joins Dr. Ken Wilgus and Jessica Pfeiffer, who explain why it's the right thing to start treating your teens like they're adults. At the end, John and Danny will address what to do if you don't like the person your teen is dating.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: Planned Emancipation Over Control
item.description:
One of the worst decisions you can make with your teens is trying to control them. Jessica Pfeiffer and Dr. Ken Wilgus talk to Jim Daly on why trying to sway all of your teen's choices is a recipe for disaster. Also, John asks Danny how parents can respond well if their teen was given some freedom, but they violated that privilege.

item.itunes:title: Replacing the Negative Effects of Screen-Time
item.description:
So many kids and parents are glued to a screen today! How can we do better in this area? Jim Daly and Arlene Pellicane address some alarming statistics on how screens and social media are negatively impacting young kids today. Than, Danny and John will give some pointers on replacing screen-time with more helpful activities.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the book Screen Kids for your donation of any amount!

 

Take the 7 Traits of Effective Parenting Assessment

 

How Your Family Can Manage Technology Well

 

When Should Your Child Get a Cellphone?

 

Your Teens Need You, Not More Screen Time

 

Support This Show!

 

If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback.

item.title: How Have You Seen God Move?
item.itunes:title: How Have You Seen God Move?
item.description:
One of the best questions you can teach your kids to ask is, "Has God ever shown up in your life?" Sarah Holmstrom and Stephanie Thurling talk with Jim Daly on how they've taught their kids to ask their friends that question. Plus, John asks Danny about some of the ways he's tried teaching his kids to pray.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Teen Suicide, and Praying for Your Kids
item.itunes:title: Teen Suicide, and Praying for Your Kids
item.description:
Many teens today are struggling with things like suicidal ideation, or even rebellion. If your son or daughter is there, where can you find hope? Jodie Berndt and Jim Daly share why praying for your teen can help turn things around. Also, Danny and John will encourage you to not throw in the towel, if your teenager is struggling now.

item.description:
If you're facing a parenting issue, who's someone's opinion you value to navigate you through it? PeggySue Wells and Pam Farrel go over an acronym called G.P.S. that explains who the most important people are to talk to about parenting choices. Plus, John and Danny will encourage you to embrace who God says you are as a parent.

item.title: When Your Love Isn’t Enough
item.itunes:title: When Your Love Isn’t Enough
item.description:
No matter how hard you try as a parent, there will be times you fall short. Danny and John discuss the sobering realization that your love by itself isn't enough to fulfill every part of your child's heart. Then, Jim Daly talks with Pam Farrel and PeggySue Wells about why God's love will be more than enough to sustain your kids.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: Still Waiting for an Answered Prayer
item.description:

You'll also hear Danny and John discuss why our hope needs to be in the Lord, and not in a specific outcome with our children.

Have you ever struggled with overprotecting your children? Many of us have. Dr. Kathy Koch joins Jim Daly to explain why our kids need to learn that their choices have consequences. Also, John and Danny will share why it's important to teach our kids to own their decisions.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: When Your Kid Struggles with Comparison
item.itunes:title: When Your Kid Struggles with Comparison
item.description:
Has your child ever said, "I'm just not good enough?" How do you respond well in those moments when he or she says that? Danny talks with John about how his daughter struggled with saying similar things about herself. Also, Lucille Williams and Jim Daly share why it's important to teach your kids about the dangers of unhealthy comparison.

item.title: Tech Use, and Our Kids’ Dating Lives
item.itunes:title: Tech Use, and Our Kids’ Dating Lives
item.description:
Smartphones have given us access to the world. But, is that good or bad? Jim Daly and David Murrow explain some of the negative ways technology has given us too much power as people. Plus, Danny and John share how technology can impact your children's dating lives, and how to have good discussions with them about that topic.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: When There’s a Breach in Your Kid’s Heart
item.itunes:title: When There’s a Breach in Your Kid’s Heart
item.description:
So many parents have a strained relationship with one or more of their kids. If you find yourself in that situation, we pray this episode will encourage you to not throw in the towel. Jim Daly and J. Warner Wallace will remind you to give yourself grace, even if you weren't the best spiritual example to your children. Also, Danny and John will discuss maintaining a relationship with your kids, even if they aren't walking with God.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.content:encoded:
All of us are busy raising our kids. As your schedule gets crowded, how do you make time to pray and hear God speak to you? Jim Daly and Courtney Ellis share how learning to hear from God is possible, even when you're super busy. Then, Danny talks with John about how learning to hear from God has helped him be a better parent.

item.itunes:title: Maturity and Forgiveness
item.description:
Seeing your son or daughter mature is very rewarding. However, if your child isn't where you want them to be, Jim Daly and Dr. Randy Schroeder will encourage you to not give up. They'll even offer some ideas for how to ask for forgiveness, if you don't get something right. Also, John and Danny will discuss why forgiveness is many times a long process.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: When a Single Mom Carries Guilt

Single parenting is very difficult, but if you or someone you know is facing that, there is hope for you. Dr. Roland Warren, who grew up in a single parent home, speaks with Jim Daly about how single moms can let go of guilt. Also, if the something feels off with a child, John and Danny will give some ideas for how a single parent can reset that relationship.

item.title: Giving Your Children Hope for Their Future Families
item.itunes:title: Giving Your Children Hope for Their Future Families
item.description:
With so many fractured families today, a lot of children question if having a family can still work. How do you inspire your kids to believe marriage and parenting are good things to pursue? Jim Daly and Dr. Roland Warren encourage single moms to cast a vision for their kids' future families. Danny and John will then address how men can still be good dads, even if you didn't have a role model to follow growing up.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the book Raising Sons of Promise for your donation of any amount!

 

Learn About the 7 Traits of Effective Parenting

 

Listen Anytime

 

Hope and Faith During Single Parent Struggles

 

Contact our Counseling Department 

 

If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback.

item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Don’t Stuff Away Childhood Trauma
item.itunes:title: Don’t Stuff Away Childhood Trauma
item.description:
Undealt with childhood trauma can last for years or even decades. If that's part of your past, how do you move forward in a healthy direction? Jim Daly talks with Dr. Roland Warren, who faced a lot of trauma growing up, and has learned to overcome it. John and Danny will also encourage you that it's never too late to find healing.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the book Raising Sons of Promise for your donation of any amount!

 

Learn About the 7 Traits of Effective Parenting

 

Listen Anytime

 

How to Recognize the Warning Signs of Childhood Trauma

 

Contact our Counseling Department 

 

If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback.

item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Privileges, Praise and Labels
item.itunes:title: Privileges, Praise and Labels
item.description:
Do your kids follow the rules you set, or is it a struggle for them to obey? While some children are more rules oriented than others, Dr. Randy Schroeder will speak with Jim Daly about why rules must be forged inside a healthy relationship with your kids. You'll also hear John and Danny bring up ways that encouragement can influence your child's behavior.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the Simple Habits for Effective Parenting book for your donation of any amount!

 

Learn About the 7 Traits of Effective Parenting

 

Listen Anytime

 

Five Characteristics of Biblical Discipline

 

4 Easy Ways to Improve the Way You Discipline 

 

If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback.

item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Reigning in the Discipline
item.itunes:title: Reigning in the Discipline
item.description:
It's frustrating when you've told a son or daughter to do something, but he or she doesn't listen. How can you discipline them in a way that's effective? Jim Daly and Dr. Randy Schroeder give some very helpful perspectives on handling discipline as a parent. Also, John and Danny will encourage more serious parents to not be too rigid.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the Simple Habits for Effective Parenting book for your donation of any amount!

item.title: When You Get Something Wrong as a Parent
item.itunes:title: When You Get Something Wrong as a Parent
item.description:
If your son or daughter is making poor choices, it's easy to fixate on wanting them to change. But in those moments, it takes a lot of humility to examine yourself. John and Danny will encourage you to do some difficult self-examinations as a parent.

 

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the A Practical Guide for Praying Parents for your donation of any amount!

 

Learn About the 7 Traits of Effective Parenting

 

Listen Anytime

Contact our Counseling Department

item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: Good Kids, or Godly Kids?
item.itunes:title: Good Kids, or Godly Kids?
item.description:
No Christian parent wants to see his or her kids struggle through adulthood. Yet sadly, that's where many parents find themselves today. John and Danny will give hope to parents who have a child that's far from God. You'll also hear from Jim Daly and Dr. Erwin Lutzer, who discuss why focusing too much on your kids' behavior is not helpful.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the A Practical Guide for Praying Parents for your donation of any amount!

 

Learn About the 7 Traits of Effective Parenting

 

Listen Anytime

 

Hope For Parents of Prodigal Children

 

Contact our Counseling Department

item.description:

item.itunes:title: Bennett’s Flower from Heaven

item.itunes:title: The Challenges of a Single Mom

item.itunes:title: Forgiving the Dad Who Left
item.description:
How does a child move on if a parent left him or her growing up? Dr. Roland Warren experienced that very thing, and he shares candidly with Jim Daly about how forgiveness was a process. You'll also hear a word of encouragement to single parents from John and Danny.

item.title: Perfectionism, Praise and Perseverance
item.itunes:title: Perfectionism, Praise and Perseverance
item.description:
Have you ever made a small mistake as a parent, but you struggled to forgive yourself over it? John and Danny share that many parents struggle with perfectionism. Also, Jim Daly and Dr. Randy Schroeder discuss better ways to deal with perfectionism by praising your kids and teaching them perseverance.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the book Simple Habits for Effective Parenting for your donation of any amount!

item.title: The Greatest Compliment a Parent Gives
item.itunes:title: The Greatest Compliment a Parent Gives
item.description:
If you walk into a public setting, so many people are on their phones. In a world so disconnected, how can you find time with your kids? Jim Daly and Dr. Randy Schroeder share why it's critical to give your kids time. Also, John and Danny address why practicing gratitude can help your relationship be more connected.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the book Simple Habits for Effective Parenting for your donation of any amount!

item.itunes:title: Praying for a Prodigal Child
item.description:
Sadly, many Christian parents have a child who's far from God. John and Danny address some of the ways the deconstruction movement is influencing young people today. Plus, Dr. Erwin Lutzer and Jim Daly share about how the parable of the prodigal son can give discouraged parents hope

item.itunes:author: Focus on the Family

item.title: When Your Child is Disrespectful
item.itunes:title: When Your Child is Disrespectful
item.description:
How do you respond when your child is disrespectful to you? While disrespect is never excused, their behavior may be because he or she isn't feeling loved. Popular author Dannah Gresh and Jim Daly share why it's important for girls to feel loved so they can show you genuine respect. You'll also hear John and Danny address why boys need to feel affirmed.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

 

Receive the book Lies Girls Believe bundle for your donation of any amount!

 

Learn About the 7 Traits of Effective Parenting

 

Listen Anytime

 

Parental Respect

 

Contact our Counseling Department 

 

If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback.

item.title: Replacing Anxiety with God’s Peace
item.itunes:title: Replacing Anxiety with God’s Peace
item.description:
Have you ever imagined the worst-case scenario on what could happen with your children? What if there is a better approach? Jim Daly speaks with Ashley Willis on how she's battled anxiety as a mom. Plus, Danny and John discuss how you can discern the difference between a healthy form of concern and toxic anxiety.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Why Did I Have an Angry Outburst?
item.itunes:title: Why Did I Have an Angry Outburst?
item.description:
Getting angry at your kids is not fun, especially if it turns into an outburst. Ashley Willis talks with Jim Daly about a time she got very mad at her kids during a trip. Also, Danny Huerta and John Fuller share how sometimes anger is rooted in fear. They'll even discuss how you can replace fear with love.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

You may have come from a family where a parent walked out on you. Dr. Roland Warren will share from his own journey about how learning to forgive his absent father brought healing. item.title: The Difference Physical Touch Can Make
item.itunes:title: The Difference Physical Touch Can Make
item.description:
If you're familiar with the 5 Love Languages, you've heard about physical touch. Counselor Randy Schroeder and Jim Daly share about some ways physical touch can have a positive influence on your kids. Plus, John and Danny will offer you ideas for making your kid feel loved, even if physical touch isn't one of his or her love languages.

item.itunes:title: Grieving the Dad Who Left

If you know someone who is raising kids as a single mom, she likely has a very moving story. Dr. Roland Warren talks with Jim Daly about some of the challenges his mother, who was a single mom, faced in her life. Then, John and Danny discuss how a mom and kids can grieve a father's absence in a healthy way.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Finding Peace When It’s Chaotic
item.itunes:title: Finding Peace When It’s Chaotic
item.description:
As a parent, you long for peace and joy. But how do you find them when life feels chaotic? Ashley Willis talks with Jim Daly about lessons we can learn from Jesus on what real peace looks like. You'll also hear John and Danny share about how to remind yourself Jesus is with you, even during a parenting storm.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Receive the book "Peace Pirates" for your donation of any amount!

item.title: Why God is My Child in Pain?
item.itunes:title: Why God is My Child in Pain?
item.description:
Have you ever seen your child in pain to the point you started asking God, "why?" Danny and John discuss how they've seen parents wrestle with the the "why God," questions. Also, Jim Daly chats with Julie Hornok about how she's learned to trust God, even with a daughter on the autism spectrum.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: When Doing Your Kids’ Laundry
item.itunes:title: When Doing Your Kids’ Laundry
item.description:
When you're caught in the next thing parenting requires of you, it can be difficult to make time to pray. Courtney Ellis talks with Jim Daly about how she made time to pray when doing laundry for her little kids. Then, you'll hear John Fuller and Danny Huerta provide some encouragement to the parents who feel like they keep getting distracted from things like prayer.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Praying for a Rebellious Young Adult Child
item.itunes:title: Praying for a Rebellious Young Adult Child
item.description:
One of the most challenging things for a Christian parent is seeing a child make poor choices. If you or someone you're close to is in that situation, Danny and John will give some ideas for how to pray for a rebellious child. Also, Jim Daly and Brenda Garrison address how she navigated through a time where her young adult daughter made poor choices.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: This Isn't a Formula!
item.itunes:title: This Isn't a Formula!
item.description:
If you have adult children, you know how raising mature kids isn't a one-size fits all formula. John and Danny will encourage you to not rely too much on formulas for raising kids. item.title: Don't Be Overly Protective
item.itunes:title: Don't Be Overly Protective
item.description:
Being overly protective of your kids is very dangerous for their overall well-being. John and Danny share how they've seen this play out with parents, and ways to encourage your kids to be resilient. Jim Daly also talks to Dr. Kathy Koch on how to not be too protective as a mom or dad.

 

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: When You Haven't Spoken a Child's Love Language

How your respond to a child's misbehavior can make them feel loved or discouraged. But what do you do when time has past, and you wonder if you haven't done the best job of making them feel loved? John and Danny provide some hope to parents who struggled to make your child feel loved as he or she was growing up. Featuring Dr. Gary Chapman and Jean Daly.

item.itunes:title: The Dangers of an Entitlement Mentality

item.itunes:title: Encouraging Your Kids, Even When They Fail

Instilling godly virtues in your child is the desire of every Christian parent. One of the best ways to do that is to go to God's Word and read it. John and Danny talk about virtues they've tried to pass on to their kids, and things they've learned from the book of Proverbs. Featuring Carey Casey.

item.description:
One of the difficult realities of having adult children is you cannot make their decisions for them. John and Danny discuss why trying to rescue your child from poor decisions isn't helpful, and how to surround yourself with godly friends if your child is struggling. Featuring Allison Bottke.

item.title: Making Your Child Feel Loved - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Making Your Child Feel Loved - Part 2
item.description:
It's been observed that in communication, it's not always about what you say, but it's also what the other person hears you say. The same principles applies for when you try to make your child feel loved. Danny and John share some of the common ways boys and girls tend to express love. Featuring Dr. Gary Chapman and Jean Daly.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Helping vs. Enabling
item.itunes:title: Helping vs. Enabling
item.description:
If your adult child is about to make a bad decision, your reaction might be to step in and stop them. However, sometimes, the most loving thing you can do is let them face the consequences of their choices. John and Danny share why enabling bad behavior is never good for your parenting. Featuring Allison Bottke.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.


Receive the book "Setting Boundaries with Your Adult Children" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2022-10-25?refcd=1503505

item.title: Building Memories, Handling Frustrations
item.itunes:title: Building Memories, Handling Frustrations
item.description:
Making memories with your children is one of the best aspects of being a parent. Yet, every parent know that some moments are joyful while others are difficult. What do you do when parenting gets frustrating? John and Danny discuss the importance of creating memories with your children and how to respond well when you face frustration. Featuring Julie Lavender.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: Thoughts for Handling Conflict
item.description:
It's unrealistic to think you can get through parenting without having any conflict with your kids. In fact, conflict is actually an opportunity for your relationship to grow. John and Danny offer hope to strong-willed parents on how to handle conflict. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.

item.title: "When You Need Me, I'm Here"
item.itunes:title: "When You Need Me, I'm Here"
item.description:
With so many changes happening in our world, it can sometimes be challenging for grandparents to feel like they're truly connecting with their grandchildren. John and Danny discuss how a simple phrase, "When you need me, I'm here," can go a long way in helping grandparents relate to their grandkids. Featuring Chrys Howard and Shellie Tomlinson.

item.itunes:title: Doubts & Giftings
item.description:
All of us as Christians have battled with doubts at some point. Instead of pretending like we have faith figured out, it's good to let our kids see us be honest about doubts we've wrestled with. John and Danny share why doing so is important, plus they'll share ways to encourage your child in the things he or she is good at. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Firstborn Parents & Having Fun
item.itunes:title: Firstborn Parents & Having Fun
item.description:
It's a common characteristic of firstborn children to be more of a rule follower personality. But no matter what your personality is, it's good to have fun with your children. John and Danny discuss how to have fun and ways to encourage your kids to be outward focused. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.


Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.description:
In the same way that you enjoy having good conversations with your kids, God wants to talk to you. But how do you make prayer a consistent part of your life? John and Danny discuss the power of prayer, and how praying for their children has changed as their kids have grown. Featuring Jodie Berndt.

item.description:
Any parent will tell you that you don't have to train your child to misbehave. But what if the reason your child is acting up is because he or she is doing too many activities. item.itunes:title: Your Daughter's Need for Attention
item.description:
The needs that a daughter has versus a son are incredibly different. One of the worst things that can happen for your girl is for her to feel like she hasn't been heard. John and Danny discuss what some of the common needs are for every daughter. Featuring Dr. Meg Meeker.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

The needs that a daughter has versus a son are incredibly different. One of the worst things that can happen for your girl is for her to feel like she hasn't been heard. John and Danny discuss what some of the common needs are for every daughter. Featuring Dr. Meg Meeker.

item.itunes:title: Sharing Why You Love God
item.description:

item.title: Where is God in This?
item.itunes:title: Where is God in This?
item.description:
When your son or daughter wants to discuss something difficult going on in the culture, your first reaction might be to shrink back in fear. However, that could be the perfect moment to share your faith. John and Danny give some helpful questions you can ask your kids when they want to talk about pressing cultural issues and entertainment. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Pointing to a Relationship with Jesus
item.itunes:title: Pointing to a Relationship with Jesus
item.description:
As your child enters the teen phase, it will likely be a time where you may need to have difficult conversations about God and faith. Yet, those discussions could be a wonderful opportunity to connect with your son or daughter. John and Danny share how engaging in awkward conversations can be a gateway to your child having a better understanding of the gospel. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: The Great Balance of Parenting
item.itunes:title: The Great Balance of Parenting
item.description:
Disciplining your child is critically important for helping him or her develop as a person. But if you overuse discipline, it can backfire on you as a parent. John and Danny explain why it's good to not repeat yourself too much when asking your kids to do something. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: Teaching Your Kids Relational Skills
item.description:
Teaching your kids good relational skills doesn't happen by accident. But what do you do when one parent isn't around or involved in your children's lives? John and Danny offer some hope to parents who are trying to raise their kids without another person's help. Featuring Dr. Kevin Leman and Jean Daly.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Talking to Your Daughter About Sex
item.itunes:title: Talking to Your Daughter About Sex
item.description:
It's not easy to talk to your daughter about sex. But, if you don't have those types of conversations, she'll get her input of what's right and wrong from other influences. John and Danny share when it's a good time to talk to your daughter about sexuality, and give hope to parents whose daughter has already crossed some boundary lines. Featuring Dr. Meg Meeker.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Praying for Your Child's Tech Use
item.itunes:title: Praying for Your Child's Tech Use
item.description:
While having rules is good for your kids, truth be told, your rules can only go so far in changing their hearts. The same is true for the ways your child makes decisions with handling technology. John talks with Danny about ways he's learned to talk to his kids about using technology. Featuring Jodie Berndt.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Praying for a Struggling Child
item.itunes:title: Praying for a Struggling Child
item.description:
If your child has left the faith, it's one of the saddest things you can discover as a parent. However, it doesn't have to be the end of the story. John and Danny discuss why praying for your child is still effective, even if your son or daughter isn't walking with Christ. Featuring Jodie Berndt.

item.title: How to Hear from God About Your Kids
item.itunes:title: How to Hear from God About Your Kids
item.description:
Sometimes as a parent, you want to make a decision. Yet, deep inside you feel like God is telling you to do something different. Danny tells John about a time he had to follow God's lead when he didn't feel like it, and provides some insights on how to hear from the Lord about your parenting. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Why Kids Leave the Faith
item.itunes:title: Why Kids Leave the Faith
item.description:
Sadly, many children who grew up in church have turned away from the faith. If you have a child who is far from God, we want to offer you some hope. John and Danny provide a dose of encouragement to parents whose child isn't walking with the Lord. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Four Categories of Faith
item.itunes:title: Four Categories of Faith
item.description:
At some point, your child must decide whether or not he or she will follow God. Sadly, many teens and young adults have walked away from the faith they were raised with. John and Danny share some common reasons why kids leave the faith, and offer a word of hope to parents whose child is far from God. Featuring David Kinnaman and Mark Matlock.

item.itunes:title: God of the Last Minute
item.description:
Many times in Scripture, God did a miracle at what seemed like the last minute. But how do you respond when God doesn't answer a prayer for your child the way you'd hoped? John and Danny offer a word of encouragement for parents who are struggling to have hope. Featuring Sheila Erwin.

item.itunes:title: Teen Sons & Substance Abuse
item.description:
Many kids and teens today are being influenced by things they see on social media. While it has it's good sides, social media can also cause your child to compare themselves with others. John and Danny share how you can encourage your child to be more outward focused in a world driven by screens. Featuring Jonathan McKee.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Helping Your Child Process Disappointment
item.itunes:title: Helping Your Child Process Disappointment
item.description:
There are moments where your child will encounter disappointment. While those situations can be tough, it's also a wonderful opportunity to train your child to respond with gratitude. John and Danny discuss why it's good to teach your son or daughter to give thanks to God in all circumstances. Featuring Sheila Erwin.

item.title: Tension With Your Teen
item.itunes:title: Tension With Your Teen
item.description:
As your child becomes a teenager, it's very common for him or her to pull away, which can lead to a lot of tension in the relationship. In this discussion, you'll hear about how boys tend to pull away from their mothers, and John and Danny share about how fathers can connect with a teen daughter as she becomes more independent. Featuring Rhonda Stoppe.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.content:encoded:
As your child becomes a teenager, it's very common for him or her to pull away, which can lead to a lot of tension in the relationship. In this discussion, you'll hear about how boys tend to pull away from their mothers, and John and Danny share about how fathers can connect with a teen daughter as she becomes more independent. Featuring Rhonda Stoppe.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Mothers Respecting Their Sons
item.itunes:title: Mothers Respecting Their Sons
item.description:
Even from a young age, boys want to be respected. As a mom, you have a unique and wonderful opportunity to show him a healthy version of what that looks like. But what if you feel like you've missed some opportunities? John and Danny offer hope to parents who feel like they didn't teach their sons healthy respect. Featuring Rhonda Stoppe.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: Letting Them Make Mistakes

item.title: When Your Child is Far from God
item.itunes:title: When Your Child is Far from God
item.description:
If you have a child who's far from God, you are not alone. While it can be one of the most heartbreaking things a parent may face, your child's story is not over. John and Danny offer hope to parents who have a child who's not walking with the Lord. Featuring Matt and Lisa Jacobson.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: Parenting or Your Career?
item.description:
Raising a child takes an extraordinary amount of time and commitment. At some point, you'll have to give up something in order to spend time with your son or daughter. John and Danny share about how they wrestled with balancing their careers and raising kids. Featuring Matt and Lisa Jacobson.

item.itunes:title: Reasons for Your Child's Emotions
item.description:
You get home after a long and exhausting day at work. But instead of coming home to a peaceful environment, your kids are at odds with each other. Sound familiar? Danny and John offer some ideas for listening to your child's emotions, even when you don't feel like it. Featuring Milan and Kay Yerkovich.

item.itunes:title: Grace for Your Child's Mistakes

item.itunes:title: Relationship Over Reputation
item.description:

item.itunes:title: Healthy Respect and Good Boundaries
item.description:
Watching your son or daughter make choices on their own can be exciting, but also nerve-wracking. But what do you do when he or she is determined to do things without your input? Danny and John give some tips on when it might be a good time to draw boundaries with your son or daughter. Featuring Matt Jacobson.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Patterns of a Pleaser
item.itunes:title: Patterns of a Pleaser
item.description:
How do you guide a child who wants to please everyone? While wanting to be liked is a good thing, trying to make everyone happy is a dangerous path for your son or daughter to walk. John and Danny discuss how to give your child a genuine confidence when he or she struggles with people pleasing. Featuring Milan and Kay Yerkovich.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: I Can't Do This!
item.description:
Raising kids is an exhausting journey. At times, you might even think to yourself, "I can't do this!" If you feel that way today, you are not alone. John and Danny will offer ideas for staying encouraged, even when you're exhausted as a parent. Featuring Heidi St. John.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Breaking Patterns of Dysfunctional Parenting
item.itunes:title: Breaking Patterns of Dysfunctional Parenting
item.description:
We all make mistakes as parents. But what do you do when a series of mistakes becomes an unhealthy pattern? The fact is, healing can take a long time. John and Danny describe how reconciliation is a process when you're trying to overcome the damage done by negative patterns. Featuring guest Mike Berry.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Get Mike Berry's book "Winning the Heart of Your Child" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-10-12?refcd=1154801

item.title: The Root of the Behavior
item.itunes:title: The Root of the Behavior
item.description:
You ask your child to do something, but instead of hearing "yes, Mom" or "yes, Dad," you get a negative response. Sound familiar? John and Danny explain why bad behavior is typically rooted in something much deeper that's going on in your child.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.title: Truly Providing for Your Family
item.itunes:title: Truly Providing for Your Family
item.description:
You want to provide for your kids' needs, but at the end of the day, what your child really wants is quality time with you. John and Danny share how they struggled to balance work with kids, and how they learned to make time for their families. Featuring guests Matt and Lisa Jacobson.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Get the book "100 Ways to Love Your Son" or the book "100 Ways to Love Your Daughter" for your donation of any amount: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-10-07?refcd=1151302

item.title: Training for Adulthood
item.itunes:title: Training for Adulthood
item.description:
"Clean you room." "Do the dishes." "Don't punch your brother!" These are basic parenting instructions. But what do you do when your child isn't listening? John and Danny explain how big changes in your child's behavior start by focusing on one area at a time.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: Encouraging Healthy Learning Habits
item.description:
It's easy to celebrate your kid when he or she makes a good grade, but what about when he or she perseveres through something difficult? John and Danny offer some thoughts on how to encourage your children when they show resilience. Featuring Michael Anderson and Dr. Timothy Johanson.

item.title: The Reason Behind the Emotions
item.itunes:title: The Reason Behind the Emotions
item.description:
An angry outburst! Sudden crying! Irrational behavior! Do these sound familiar? Many times, when your child has an outburst, there's usually a deeper reason under the surface. John and Danny discuss how to affirm your child when he or she is struggling emotionally.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast, or call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

item.itunes:title: A Safe Place for Feelings

item.itunes:title: The Difference Between Honesty & Complaining

Parenting is a marathon, and it's helpful to keep the end goal in mind: you're preparing your kids for adulthood. John and Danny discuss the dangers of believing your primary job is to make your child happy.

Find us online at focusonthefamily.com/parentingpodcast. Or, call 1-800-A-FAMILY.

Get the book "GIST: The Essence of Raising Life-Ready Kids" with your donation of any amount!: https://donate.focusonthefamily.com/don-fofp-podcast-2021-04-06?refcd=1086203

Get more episode resources: https://www.focusonthefamily.com/episodes/focus-on-parenting-podcast/is-it-your-job-to-make-your-child-happy/#featured-resource-cta

If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback: https://focusonthefamily.com/podcastsurvey/

item.itunes:title: Getting a Handle On Godly Discipline

item.title: Disciplining Your Kids With Love and Limits, Part 2
item.itunes:title: Disciplining Your Kids With Love and Limits, Part 2
item.description: In a conversation centered on their book Put the Disciple Into Discipline, Erin MacPherson and her mother, Ellen Schuknecht, discuss the importance of parents demonstrating love in the midst of disciplining their children. Erin and Ellen also talk about teaching our kids self-control, helping them (and ourselves) become slow to anger, and faith training. Receive the book Put the Disciple into Discipline for your donation of any amount!
